page.title: 11Watton Priory
page.content: The existing church of St. Mary dates from the 13th Century and stands within the precincts of the Priory (about 42 acres). The rectangular site is bounded and intersected by banks and ditches. While the Priory may have had Saxon origins, the site is typical of Gilbertine monasteries. It is known that a Gilbertine Priory was founded c.1150 by Eustace Fitzjohn, but there is little other information, except that upon its surrender in 1539/40 the Priory was valued at Â£360. The ruins were excavated in 1893 by the East Riding Antiquarian Society. The tenant of the "Abbey" then was Mr. Richard Beckitt - there is a memorial window to the Beckitt family in St. Mary's church. The only part of the Priory still in existence formed the Prior's lodging, and this dates to the 14th and 15th Centuries.
